questions.question: What is the primary legislation governing companies in India?
questions.explanation: The Companies Act, 2013 is the primary legislation that governs companies in India, replacing the Companies Act, 1956.

questions.question: Which of the following are types of companies under the Companies Act, 2013?
questions.explanation: Private Limited, Public Limited, and One Person Company are types of companies under the Companies Act, 2013. LLP is governed by a separate act. Note: This question originally had multiple correct answers, but the current quiz system supports single answers only.
